meanings.definition: To apply a new layer of glaze to (a surface)
meanings.sent1: I will reglaze the pottery to make it shiny again.
meanings.sent2: The artist decided to reglaze the ceramic vase for a glossy finish.
meanings.sent3: After the clumsy cat knocked over the vase, I had to reglaze it to hide the cracks.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to reglaze the room with warmth and happiness.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays reglazed the lake, creating a sparkling effect.

meanings.definition: To put new glass in (a window, etc.)
meanings.sent1: We need to reglaze the window to keep out the cold air.
meanings.sent2: The old house had to reglaze all its windows to improve insulation.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally broke the glass, so now we have to reglaze the window.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes seemed to reglaze with tears as she remembered the past.
meanings.sent5: The storm shattered the glass, and we had to reglaze the windows quickly.
